title: Cynthia Erivo opts for quirky white dress and green hair at special screening of biopic Harriet
text:
She plays American abolitionist Harriet Taubman in a new biopic opening in theatres on November 1.

And on Thursday night, London-born actress Cynthia Erivo headlined a special screening of the movie in New York.

The 32-year-old sported bright green hair and an off-the-shoulder white dress.

Big role: She plays American abolitionist Harriet Taubman in a new biopic and on Thursday, London-born actress Cynthia Erivo headlined a special screening of the movie in New York

Her dress had red and black stripe detailing and short sleeves as well as a flared knee-length skirt.

It was worn over a sheer long-sleeve shirt with buttoned up collar and she added black shoes.

Erivo made her name in the role of Celie in the Broadway revival of The Color Purple for which she won a Tony Award in 2016.

Last year, she appeared in two Hollywood movies - Widows and Bad Times at the El Royale.

On trend: The 32-year-old sported bright green hair and an off-the-shoulder white dress that had red and black stripe detailing and short sleeves as well as a flared knee-length skirt

Quirky: The dress was worn over a sheer long-sleeve shirt with buttoned up collar and she added black shoes and glossy red lip color

Tubman, who died in 1913, was a former slave who, after escaping herself, continued to help other slaves to freedom via the so-called Underground Railroad in the mid-19th century.

She continued her anti-slavery activism during the Civil War after which she returned to property she owned in Auburn, New York, where she cared for her elderly parents.

The biopic is directed by Kasi Lemmons and co-stars Janelle Monae, Joe Alwyn, Leslie Odom Jr. and Jennifer Nettles.

And Erivo isn't done with biopics yet.

Earlier this month, it was confirmed she will star as Aretha Franklin in the new season of Nat Geo's anthology series Genius slated to air in 2020.

Stylish: Jennifer Nettles, who co-stars in Harriet with Erivo, supported the event and looked lovely in a tuxedo pant suit and silky white shirt with black buttons

Celebrities: Also on the guest list for the screening was Lena Waithe, left, and LaLa Anthony, right
